current-chamber.#text: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

official-title.#text:
To amend title 38, United States Code, to improve
		  benefits and assistance provided to surviving spouses of veterans under laws
		  administered by the Secretary of Veterans Affairs, and for other
		  purposes.

header.#text:
Benefits for
			 children of certain Thailand service veterans born with spina bifida

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: , is amended by adding at the end the following new section:

header.#text:
Benefits for
				children of certain Thailand service veterans born with spina bifida

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
may provide to any child of a veteran of
				covered service in Thailand who is suffering from spina bifida the health care,
				vocational training and rehabilitation, and monetary allowance required to be
				paid to a child of a Vietnam veteran who is suffering from spina bifida under

as if such child of a veteran of covered service
				in Thailand were a child of a Vietnam veteran who is suffering from spina
				bifida under such subchapter.

text.#text: The

This section applies with respect to all forms
				and manifestations of spina bifida, except spina bifida occulta.

For purposes of this section, a
				veteran of covered service in Thailand is any individual, without regard to the
				characterization of that individual's service, who—

Veteran of
				covered service in Thailand

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: in consultation with the

, during the period
				beginning on January 9, 1962, and ending on May 7, 1975; and

				active military, naval, or air service in Thailand, as determined by the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: , in consultation with the

, to have been
				exposed to a herbicide agent during such service in Thailand.

is determined by

header.#text:
Pilot program on
			 grief counseling in retreat settings for surviving spouses of veterans who die
			 while serving on active duty in the Armed Forces

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall carry out,
			 through the

, a pilot program to assess the feasibility and advisability of
			 providing grief counseling services described in
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
Readjustment Counseling Service of the Veterans Health
			 Administration

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
in group
			 retreat settings to surviving spouses of veterans who die while serving on
			 active duty in the Armed Forces.

text.#text:
Commencing not later than 180 days after the date of the
			 enactment of this Act, the

The participation of a surviving
			 spouse in the pilot program under this section shall be at the election of the
			 surviving spouse.

header.#text:
Participation
			 at election of surviving spouse

text.#text:
The services provided to a surviving spouse under the
			 pilot program shall include the following:

Information and
			 counseling on coping with grief.

Information about
			 benefits and services available to surviving spouses under laws administered by
			 the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
considers appropriate to assist a
			 surviving spouse under the pilot program with adjusting to the death of a
			 spouse.

text.#text:
Such other
			 information and counseling as the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall carry out the pilot program at not fewer than six locations as
			 follows:

text.#text: The

Three locations
			 at which surviving spouses with dependent children are encouraged to bring
			 their children.

Three locations
			 at which surviving spouses with dependent children are not encouraged to bring
			 their children.

The
			 pilot program shall be carried out during the two-year period beginning on the
			 date of the commencement of the pilot program.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall submit to

a report on the pilot
			 program.

text.#text:

			 year of the pilot program and not later than 180 days after the completion of
			 the pilot program, the

shall contain the findings and conclusions
			 of the

as a result of the pilot program, and shall include such

considers appropriate.
